edu.vserver.exercises.helpers
Class XmlEncHelper<E extends ExerciseData>

java.lang.Object
  edu.vserver.exercises.helpers.XmlEncHelper<E>
Type Parameters:
E - exercise type specific data model
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExerciseXMLHandler<E>, java.io.Serializable
public class XmlEncHelper<E extends ExerciseData>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExerciseXMLHandler<E>

If a JavaBean representation exists for a certain data model it is possible to use the XML formatting services offered by the java.beans.[ XMLDecoder | XMLEncoder ]-classes.

This class implements the ExerciseXMLHandler with the assumption of having a valid JavaBean representation of the ExerciseData -interface's implementor available. It is thus able to un-bind the forming and reading of an XML presentation from the specific exercise type. This class is capable of producing ready to save XML streams from beans as well as to read and convert them back to beans.

Even though using this method is probably the easiest way of implementing ExerciseXMLHandler, it is not recommended, as it provides less options for preserving backwards compatibility if changes to ExerciseData are needed than implementing the XML-conversion by hand would provide.

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie (Doc)
See Also:
